issue.title: [R] Follow on to more examples
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12901](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12901). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I accidentally merged ARROW-12841 (PR: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10368) I will review (post-facto) and we can use this for the PR changes if we need any.

Comments

https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10368/files#diff-9fe1a055f9a4df7088de4e0c759c20138422b8bdb9bba04ed74c7881aa787019R66-R67
Should this use `@examplesIf` ?

https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10368/files#diff-0229d62b9653ff7124e6e2f202e51d46d4d8fcaf14baf83ccf8c047c7c344579R78-R80
These are both genuine questions, I'm not sure we want to include either or both of them:
- This might be too much indirection, but would it be better/easier to use `write_dataset() here?
- Do we want to talk about reading a partitioned dataset here?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12901?focusedCommentId=17359412) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
Issue resolved by pull request 10436
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10436>
